intro: Pavetta quinqueflora, commonly known as five-flowered pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers and opposite, simple leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Pavetta quinqueflora is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
